headline: A heat dome will settle over France for several days, with temperatures reaching up to 40°C
subhead: The heatwave is intensifying and spreading across France. It will peak on Monday and Tuesday, with temperatures rising to 36°C and 38°C (around 96 to 100°F) over two-thirds of the country. This heatwave bears the signature of human-induced climate change.

headline: To fight rhino poaching, nothing works better than cutting off their horns
subhead: According to a study conducted in 11 South African reserves between 2017 and 2023, dehorning reduced poaching by 78%.

Four Syrian weddings, a symbol of reconciliation
subhead: In Latakia, a Syrian coastal city that has been the site of killings targeting the Alawite minority, four Sunni and Shiite couples had a joint wedding. The celebration aimed to counter the sectarian divisions tearing the country apart, as illustrated by an attack on a church in Damascus in June.

headline: Five cultural outings to enjoy with a baby in Paris
subhead: Sensory tours at the Musée Rodin and Musée de l'Orangerie, mezzo forte concerts from the Orchestre Lamoureux, joyful splashing at Centquatre-Paris: More and more cultural venues in the French capital are offering activities for children under the age of two.
